Package com.jpaulmorrison.fbp.core.engine

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Comparator
    A clone of java.util.Comparator from JDK 1.2.
    InputPort
    This class is used within components to declare instance variables that hold input ports.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Component
    All components must extend this class, defining its two abstract methods openPorts and execute.
    ConnArray
    This class is an internal control block used while processing a component's annotations; it is also used for checking 'connect' invocations in network definitions
    Connection
    This class implements buffering between Component threads.
    DispIPCounts
    Generate a stream of IP counts under control of a timer
    DummyMain  
    InitializationConnection
    This class provides connections that hold just a single object at network setup time.
    Network
    The abstract class which all flow networks extend directly or indirectly.
    NullOutputPort  
    OutArray
    This class is an internal control block used while processing a component's annotations; it is also used for checking 'connect' invocations in network definitions
    OutputPort
    This class is used within components to declare instance variables that hold output ports.
    Packet<T>
    A Packet may either contain an Object, when type is NORMAL , or a String, when type is not NORMAL.
    Port  
    SubIn
    Look after input to subnet - added for subnet support
    SubInSS
    Look after input to subnet - added for subnet support.
    SubNet  
    SubOI
    Look after (synchronous) output/input from/to subnet.
    SubOut
    Look after output from subnet - added for subnet support
    SubOutSS
    Look after output from subnet - added for subnet support Differs from SubOut in that it adds an open bracket at the beginning, and a close bracket at the end
    TimeoutHandler  
    VersionAndTimestamp  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ComponentException  
    FlowError
    Instances of this class are thrown whenever a programming error in a flow network is detected.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    ComponentDescription  
    InPort  
    InPorts
    Annotation for component, describing multiple input ports on a component
    MustRun  
    OutPort  
    OutPorts  
    Priority
